texts.NIV: <sup>2</sup>I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of Egypt, out of the land of slavery. <sup>3</sup>You shall have no other gods before me.
texts.KJV: <sup>2</sup>I am the LORD thy God, which have brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage. <sup>3</sup>Thou shalt have no other gods before me.
texts.NVI: <sup>2</sup>Yo soy el SEÑOR tu Dios. Yo te saqué de Egipto, del país donde eras esclavo. <sup>3</sup>No tengas otros dioses además de mí.

texts.NIV: <sup>26</sup>You are to be holy to me because I, the LORD, am holy, and I have set you apart from the nations to be my own.
texts.KJV: <sup>26</sup>And ye shall be holy unto me: for I the LORD am holy, and have severed you from other people, that ye should be mine.
texts.NVI: <sup>26</sup>Sean ustedes santos porque yo, el Señor, soy santo y los he distinguido entre las demás naciones, para que sean míos.

texts.NIV: <sup>17</sup>In the same way, faith by itself, if it is not accompanied by action, is dead.
texts.KJV: <sup>17</sup>Even so faith, if it hath not works, is dead, being alone.
texts.NVI: <sup>17</sup>Así también la fe por sí sola, si no tiene obras, está muerta.

texts.NIV: <sup>14</sup>if my people, who are called by my name, will humble themselves and pray and seek my face and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven, and I will forgive their sin and will heal their land.
texts.KJV: <sup>14</sup>If my people, which are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways; then will I hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin, and will heal their land.
texts.NVI: <sup>14</sup>si mi pueblo, que lleva mi nombre, se humilla y ora, y me busca y abandona su mala conducta, yo lo escucharé desde el cielo, perdonaré su pecado y restauraré su tierra.

texts.NIV: <sup>13</sup>Keep your servant also from willful sins; may they not rule over me. Then I will be blameless, innocent of great transgression. <sup>14</sup>May these words of my mouth and this meditation of my heart be pleasing in your sight, LORD, my Rock and my Redeemer.
texts.KJV: <sup>13</sup>Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous sins; let them not have dominion over me: then shall I be upright, and I shall be innocent from the great transgression. <sup>14</sup>Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O LORD, my strength, and my redeemer.
texts.NVI: <sup>13</sup>Libra, además, a tu siervo de pecar a sabiendas; no permitas que tales pecados me dominen. Así estaré libre de culpa y de multiplicar mis pecados. <sup>14</sup>Sean, pues, aceptables ante ti mis palabras y mis pensamientos, oh SEÑOR, roca mía y redentor mío.

texts.NIV: <sup>7</sup>The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
texts.KJV: <sup>7</sup>The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
texts.NVI: <sup>7</sup>El temor del SEÑOR es el principio del conocimiento; los necios desprecian la sabiduría y la disciplina.

texts.NIV: <sup>45</sup>For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.
texts.KJV: <sup>45</sup>For even the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.
texts.NVI: <sup>45</sup>Porque ni aun el Hijo del hombre vino para que le sirvan, sino para servir y para dar su vida en rescate por muchos.
